page.title: 11Interviews
page.content: Mrs. Evans teaches music in our school on Wednesdays. She is a parent and a Governor of the school. Her family is about to move house but we won't be losing them because they are simply moving to a larger house in the village as they are a family of six. The Evans family have lived in Hornby for almost 15 years and would be very reluctant to move away. The rural setting is ideal in which to bring up the children and the 20 km journey to work Prof. Evans makes is a small price to pay. They were impressed in the way they were made welcome when they first arrived in Hornby; they believe this is still the case when new families arrive now. Tim Hepple was aware of this welcome when his family retired here a few years ago. At 17, Tim enjoys the area even if it is quiet at times! As the church organist he can be noisy!
